newsitem.title: USA: System Software to raise $137 mln in deals.
newsitem.headline: System Software to raise $137 mln in deals.

text.p: System Software Associates Inc said Monday it will raise $137 million in two separate subordinated note transactions.
In the first, System Software will offer $90 million in subordinated convertible notes due 2002. It filed a registration statement for the notes with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
In the second, about $47 million in junior subordinated notes, along with associated, detachable stock purchase warrants, will be purchased by a private investor group.
The company said the transactions will provide additional working capital and allow it repay existing outstanding bank debt and obligations to note holders.

The investor group also will supplement the board of directors and existing management team. In a statement, Roger Covey, chairman, said he looked forward to the investors' contribution to help continue the company's recent growth.

System Software said the note public offering will be underwritten by Alex. Brown & Sons Inc. The interest rate and conversion price of the notes will be determined based upon market conditions at the time the notes are sold.
The $47 million in notes will be purchased by a group consisting of Bain Capital Inc, JMI Equity Fund III LP and an affiliate of the Pritzker family.

The junior notes mature in 2003 and will be subordinated to the public notes. The warrants will entitle the private investors to purchase shares of preferred stock or 19.9 percent of the company's outstanding common stock.
The warrants are exercisable at approximately 85 percent of the current market price of the common stock.
This second transaction is expected to close concurrently with the public note offering.
